content.description:
Atticus remains neutral.

1Â Incidit Caesarianum civile bellum cum haberet Atticus

annos circiter sexaginta. Usus est aetatis vacationevacatio, -ionis, f.: exemption, excuse

neque se quoquamquoquam: anywhere movit ex urbe. Quae amicis suis

opus fuerant ad Pompeium proficiscentibus, omnia

5ex sua re familiari dedit. Ipsum Pompeium

coniunctumconiunctus, -a, -um: related by marriage non offendit. Nullum ab eo habebat

ornamentum, ut ceteri, qui per eum aut honores

aut divitias ceperant; quorum partim invitissimi

castra sunt secuti, partim summa cum eius offensione

10domi remanserunt.
content.question: According to lines 2-3, (Usus . . . urbe), Atticus avoided involvement in the civil war by

choices.label: claiming he was too old to fight
sending his friends to talk to Pompey

content.answer: claiming he was too old to fight
